description: After a discreet, tense exchange at Bar 101, Sven Halek decides to slip select activists detailed hints on exploiting a dormant BCI pilot code, aiming to trigger citywide temporary score equalization.
Activists, aided by Harmonist insiders, use Sven's guidance to access legacy BCI permissions. Multiple neighborhoods unexpectedly see all residents' scores reset to equal status.

Citizens across impacted districts enjoy equal access to jobs, housing, and services. Brief euphoria turns into unrest as people experience life without BCI barriers, sparking large-scale demonstrations demanding lasting change.
Directorate rapidly intervenes, revoking the equal status and restoring original scores. Emergency system lockdowns cause further disruptions, intensifying public anger.

Mass protests persist citywide as awareness spreads, with citizens calling for BCI abolition and full equality. Council is forced into urgent session to address vulnerabilities and propose reforms, but trust continues to erode.
